snippet: The company says it filed a suit against environmental groups in hopes of speeding up the judicial review that will come if and when they challenge its drilling plan.
abstract: Oil giant Shell files suit in federal court in Alaska against a dozen environmental groups, employing a rare, and rarely successful, legal effort to pre-empt anticipated challenges to its plans to begin exploration in the Arctic Ocean this summer; because the window for ice-free drilling in the Arctic lasts at most three months, any delay could be fatal to Shell; company is moving personnel and equipment to the North Slope to prepare for the short season and will continue to invest in the project.
lead_paragraph: The company says it filed a suit against environmental groups in hopes of speeding up the judicial review that will come if and when they challenge its drilling plan.

headline.seo: Shell Files Pre-emptive Lawsuit Over Alaska Drilling
headline.main: Legal Strategy Taken by Shell Is Rarely Successful
headline.print_headline: Legal Strategy Taken by Shell Is Rarely Successful
